name: Ethylene (Ethene)

energies.comment: CONTROL CASE: Simple C=C double bond + 4 C-H bonds with NO cycles, NO conjugation, NO resonance. Violation is -1.0 ± 0.5 kJ/mol (essentially ZERO within uncertainty). CONFIRMS additivity works perfectly for simple molecules as predicted. Calculated from NIST: ΔHf = 52.4 ± 0.5 kJ/mol → BDE = (2×716.68 + 4×218.0) - 52.4 = 2253 kJ/mol. CORRECTED from previous value (2275, +21 kJ/mol) which was fabricated (+22 kJ/mol error).
energies.source: Manion 2002 (citing Gurvich et al. 1991); NIST Chemistry WebBook
energies.confidence_note: NIST-verified with tight uncertainty (±0.5 kJ/mol). Perfect control case - validates that additivity works for simple molecules.

notes: Ethylene: simplest alkene with C=C double bond
No cycles, no resonance, no conjugation, no special structure
CONTROL CASE: Confirms additivity works perfectly when it should
Tests that detector doesn't overfit - simple molecules should decompose cleanly
π-bond is localized between two carbons (not delocalized like benzene)
Previous dataset value (+21 kJ/mol) was the ANOMALY that triggered systematic verification
Correcting this revealed fabrications in multiple other molecules
